x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Public schools and community centers often receive donated computers, tablets, and network equipment, but lack technical support for maintenance and repair. When these devices fail, classrooms lose access to digital learning for weeks, and equipment data is often outdated or missing. There’s no centralized view of asset health, warranty, or technician availability.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

EduField Sync connects the Field Service Management (FSM) and CMDB modules to create an intelligent field support network for schools.

Using the Service Portal, school staff can easily report issues by scanning a QR code or selecting a device from the inventory.
FSM automatically dispatches the nearest technician with the right skills, based on location and issue type.
Once the work order is completed, the technician’s mobile app updates the CMDB and Asset record with repair details, replaced parts, and photos.

The platform also provides dashboards showing device uptime, repair frequency, and MTTR per school, enabling proactive maintenance and smarter resource planning.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Field Service Management
  • CMDB
  • Asset Management
  • Mobile App

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Maintaining accurate CMDB data over time.
  • Ensuring technician routing optimization in remote or low-connectivity regions.
  • Managing spare parts and stockroom logistics.
  • Encouraging adoption among non-technical school staff.
